title: NIA court frames charges against 5 ISIS accused who used matchsticks to make bombs
title_page: NIA court frames charges against 5 ISIS accused who used matchsticks to make bombs - India News
text:
The NIA special court in Delhi framed charges against five accused ISIS members on Monday.
The ISIS terror module in question learnt to make bombs out of matchstick heads.
This was discovered by NIA sleuths from one of the accused Akhlakur Rehman alias Akhlaq from whose mobile, the officials recovered an e-book on bomb making, titled "Bomb banane ka asan tariqa".
The conspiracy took place in 2014-15 when the five accused formed a group to unleash terror in various parts of country.
Mohammed Azeemushan, Mohammed Osama alias Adil (Peer), Mohammed Mehraj alias Monu and Akhlaq, are from Roorkie in Uttarakhand while the fifth accused, Mohsin Ibrahim Sayyed, is a resident of Malad West, Mumbai.

THE CASE
All five were charged by the NIA for forming a terror module, with the accused owing allegiance to ISIS.
With instructions from Syria-based Indian handler Shafi Armar, the module conspired and planned to carry out a terrorist act by assembling and planting IEDs to strike terror across the country.
Reading the e-book thoroughly, the module learnt how to assemble IED using the explosive material extracted from match sticks. Following instructions from the terror literature, the module purchased match boxes in bulk and extracted the matchstick heads.
These explosives were later recovered from the possession of accused Azeemushan.
According to NIA chargesheet, the accused also held several meetings at Lucknow and Deoband to conspire with other radicalised youth, who are also under investigation.
The case has been listed for prosecution evidence on December 16 and 16.
The case was registered by Delhi Police Special Cell in January, this year.
The NIA took over the investigation in March, after an order from the Ministry of Home Affairs.
